snippet: “Sweetbitter,” by the 30-year-old waitress Stephanie Danler, is but one in a crop of debut novels acquired by publishers in lucrative deals.
abstract: Six-figure, two-book deal for Stephanie Danler, New York City waitress, with Alfred A Knopf is latest in string of splashy contracts for debut novelists; deal is also a sign that publishers are once again taking chances on unknown writers; Danler's book Sweetbitter is due out in 2016.
lead_paragraph: “Sweetbitter,” by the 30-year-old waitress Stephanie Danler, is but one in a crop of debut novels acquired by publishers in lucrative deals.

headline.seo: Waitress Is One of Many New Writers With Big Book Deals
headline.main: And Our Fiction Special Tonight Is ...
headline.print_headline: And Our Fiction Special Tonight Is ...
